newsitem.title: USA: IBM up, Prudential makes positive comments.
newsitem.headline: IBM up, Prudential makes positive comments.

text.p: Shares of International Business Machines Corp jumped after Prudential Securities analyst Don Young made some positive comments about the company's mainframe announcement next week, traders said.
Also on Friday, IBM executives are holding a meeting with securities analysts to discuss their Internet strategy, but analysts do not expect any news to come from that meeting.

Next week, the computer giant plans to introduce the next upgrade of its low-cost CMOS mainframe computer line, on September 10. Young's office confirmed that he made positive comments about the announcement, but Young was not available.
Shares of IBM were up 1-3/4 to 114-7/8 in active trading.
IBM's newest mainframe models are widely anticipated by Wall Street and by IBM's customers, who have been waiting for the new models, which have faster processing power.
IBM is holding a conference call to announce the new models next Tuesday.
